attributes.action: Stop good english words from being exploited to diguise misleading advertising and marketing schemes
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
Numerous travel packagers, car rental companies and others offer a pricing scheme which they refer to as "dynamic pricing". They charge buyers different prices depending on such unfair factors as where they live, sex, and other discriminatory practices. 

The true meaning of "dynamic pricing" is in fact quite the opposite. Prices are "dynamic" when they are allowed to float continuously in any direction in an open free marketplace. Any buyer and any seller can agree to trade, without regard to anything but the price. The stock market is the most common example of "dynamic pricing".   

Airline style "dynamic pricing" is in fact "fixed pricing" NOT "dynamic pricing" Prices are set according to buyer circumstances and NOT allowed to be moved by free market forces.(the word "fixed" is a direct opposite to the word "dynamic")

At the very least these traders should be forced to use the term "differential pricing" to describe such discriminatory pricing schemes.
